sen.j: 法泉寺（ほうせんじ）は、京都府京田辺市にある真言宗智山派の寺院。
sen.e: Hosen-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Shingon Sect Chisan School located in Kyotanabe City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Hosen-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Shingon Sect Chisan School located in Kyotanabe City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Hosen-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Shingon Sect Chisan School located in Kyotanabe City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Its sango (honorific mountain prefix) is Chutozan.
Its sango (honorific mountain prefix) is Chutozan.
Its sango (honorific mountain prefix) is Mt. Chuto.
The principal image is the Eleven-faced Kannon.
The principal image is the Eleven-faced Kannon.
The principal image is the Eleven-faced Kannon.

sen.j: この寺の創建年代等については不詳であるが、天長年間（824年～834年）この地が干ばつに見舞われたとき、本尊の十一面観音の力により泉がわいたことから寺号を法泉寺としたという。
sen.e: The time of Hosen-ji Temple's founding is unknown but it is said that the temple was named Hosen-ji (lit. Buddhist Sprong Temple) after the Eleven-faced Kannon statue caused springs to flow when the area experienced drought during the Tencho era (824-834).

The time of Hosen-ji Temple's founding is unknown but it is said that the temple was named Hosen-ji (lit. Buddhist Sprong Temple) after the Eleven-faced Kannon statue caused springs to flow when the area experienced drought during the Tencho era (824-834).

The time of Hosen-ji Temple's founding is unknown but it is said that the temple was named Hosen-ji (lit. Buddhist Spring Temple) after the Eleven-faced Kannon statue caused springs to flow when the area experienced drought during the Tencho era (824-834).

sen.j: 十三重石塔（「弘安元年」（＝1278年）在銘）
sen.cmt: 米国スペルに統一するため、13-storyとしました。

sen.j: 三宝大荒神石塔（「明応七年」（＝1498年）在銘）
sen.e: Wild deity of the three treasures stone pagoda (inscribed with the year 1498)
